content: Has there been any discussion of supporting / encouraging use of OpenJDK for the FHIR tooling? With Oracle introducing per-user per-month licensing for Java SE 8+, using Oracle Java SE may start to be a hassle. The cost isn't too bad ($2.50/month), but I'd rather not have to deal w/ maintaining a subscription. Has anyone tried OpenJDK recently?
I run the IGPublisher via OpenJDK and it works fine for me.
OK good -- I'm going to try running the IG Publisher this was for the auto-build pipeline too.
isn't the auto-build what we are talking about?
This thread was about tools Chris runs on his own, locally.
and David's comment that the IG publisher works with OpenJDK gives me confidence that this might work (which is good, because I don't have a great alternative in 2019).

I was mainly interested in the IG Publisher, as it is the FHIR tooling I used the most -- but I occasionally need to build the core FHIR stuff too. I can confirm now that I was able to successfully run the IG Publisher using an AdoptOpenJDK OpenJDK 8 HotSpot build for Mac.
Yeah, and now successfully running behind https://hl7-fhir.github.io/auto-ig-builder/builds.html
